explanation: Uses rundll32 to call ShellExec_RunDLL as a proxy to launch mshta with a remote HTA, chaining trusted components to execute external content.
rationale_steps: PowerShell starts rundll32 with ShellExec_RunDLL export from shell32.dll.
ShellExec_RunDLL spawns mshta pointing to a remote HTA for execution.
The chain relies on signed Windows binaries; unusual pairing of ShellExec_RunDLL with mshta and remote URLs is the detection point.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: Well-formed rundll32 invocation with valid arguments and no quoting or parsing issues for PowerShell/CMD.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: While it plausibly proxies execution to mshta to run a remote HTA, this aligns more with Signed Binary Proxy Execution (T1218, mshta/rundll32) than System Script Proxy Execution (T1216), and the URL uses a documentation-only IP.
